section.title: Compact Evidence Format
section.t: For bandwidth-constrained environments, this section defines a compact evidence format that reduces the per-packet overhead while maintaining verifiability.

section.title: Delta Encoding
section.t: In the compact format, each packet after the first encodes only the differences from the previous packet:

list.t: Timestamps are encoded as millisecond deltas from the previous packet.
Metrics are encoded as deltas from the running mean, using variable-length integer encoding.
The content-hash is omitted when unchanged from the previous window (indicating a pause in editing).

section.title: Evidence Bundle
section.t: A compact evidence bundle wraps a complete evidence chain for a single document session. The bundle header contains:

list.t: The total packet count and chain duration.
A Merkle root over all packet hashes for random-access verification.
A COSE_Sign1 signature over the bundle header using the Attester's device key.
